Package model.card

Class DeckImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.card.DeckImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Deck
    public class DeckImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Deck
    This class is the concrete implementation of the Deck interface and is used to represent a deck of card.

    Note: There is no public constructor in this class. Making one will fail the validator. Instead the factory methods createSortedDeck() and createSortedDeck() should be used to create a deck.

    Author:
    Ross Nye

      • createSortedDeck

        public static Deck createSortedDeck()
        Creates a sorted (ordered) deck of cards. The cards are order by suit in ascending alphabetical order clubs (lowest), followed by diamonds, hearts, and spades (highest) and rank in natural order (ACE, 2, ... 10, Jack, Queen, King).

        All the clubs should be followed by all the diamonds, then hearts then spades. The first card being the Ace of Clubs, the last the King of Spades.

        Returns:
        a complete, sorted deck of cards
        See Also:
        Deck, Card, Suit, Rank

      • createShuffledDeck

        public static Deck createShuffledDeck()
        Creates a complete, but shuffled (randomised order) deck of cards.

        As with createSortedDeck() the deck shall contain a card for all valid combinations of Suit and Rank. Unlike createSortedDeck() this method should return the deck with the cards shuffled (in a randomised order)

        Returns:
        a complete, shuffled deck of cards
        See Also:
        Deck, Card, Suit, Rank

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
